meanings.definition: A member of the majority faction of the Russian Social Democratic Party, which seized power in the October Revolution of 1917.
meanings.sent1: The bolsheviks were the group that took control in the Russian Revolution.
meanings.sent2: Many people followed the bolsheviks during the October Revolution.
meanings.sent3: The bolsheviks must have been very determined to succeed.
meanings.sent4: Their unity made them as strong as the bolsheviks in the party.
meanings.sent5: The image of the bolsheviks storming the Winter Palace is unforgettable.

meanings.definition: A supporter of the Bolsheviks or their policies.
meanings.sent1: She was a dedicated bolsheviks supporter.
meanings.sent2: The bolsheviks' ideas appealed to many people.
meanings.sent3: Being a bolsheviks fan meant always being involved in politics.
meanings.sent4: Her loyalty to the bolsheviks was unwavering.
meanings.sent5: He defended the bolsheviks' principles with passion.
